Opportunity

Opportunity is the means or avenue by which the bank employee commits fraud, and the factor over which the bank has the most control. By implementing a strong system of internal controls, a bank reduces an employee's opportunity to commit fraud and increases the chance of detecting the fraud earlier.

The bank may do this through the following measures:

  • Implementing strong internal controls (such as dual controls and segregation of duties),
  • Establishing a culture of ethics (e.g., "ethical tone at the top"),
  • Establishing a code of conduct, including an anonymous hotline for reporting suspected fraud, and
  • Proactively monitoring for fraud through tests, audits, and automated computer systems.
